page.title: 05A DYMCHURCH HOUSING ESTATE
page.content: Beach Estate is on the Eastern outskirts of Dymchurch. There are about three hundred houses on the estate. A number of services are provided. The Council collects rubbish once a week. Help the Aged has its own van which comes twice or three times a week to take all the old people for a day out. The Spastics Society comes to take disabled children to a special school in Folkestone. The Postman makes two deliveries and collections a day. The collections are at 8.30am and 4.00pm. The Milkman delivers milk from 7.00am to 8.00am. There is one telephone box on the Estate. There is only one shop in the Estate. It is called General Stores. It sells everything from sweets and Sunday dinner to medical supplies. There are two stops for the regular bus service between Dover and Hastings.
